alert.note: Alert for Hill; Liberty; Toole (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Liberty, northeastern Toole, western Hill and northwestern Chouteau Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 30 miles east of Sunburst to 16 miles northeast of The Knees. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways will cause difficult driving on rural roads. Locations impacted include... Chester, Joplin, Inverness, Lothair, Gildford, Hingham, Rudyard, Whitlash and Tiber Dam. This includes Highway 2 between mile markers 308 and 353. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for north central Montana.
